Class Store

java.lang.Object
  Store
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Store
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Used to store account records in an array list, in which can be placed within a file, extracted from a file and used to navigate through account records with the AccountGUI class. The ATMServer uses this class to retrieve and store account information for use with the ATMClient

Author:
Jamie Brindle (06352322)
See Also:
Serialized Form

private static long serialVersionUID
           
 
Constructor Summary
Store()
          Constructs the store, creates an array list for account records to be stored
 
Method Summary
 void addAccount(Account account)
          Add an account to the array list
 Account currentAccount()
          Returns the account corresponding the the currentAccountIndex which are navigated through by the firstAccountPointer, lastAccountPointer, previousAccountPointer and nextAccountPointer methods
 void displayAll()
          A method which prints all the account records found within a store to the screen in a way that the user can understand
 Store fileIn(java.lang.String fileName)
          Opens a file and casts the object found within that file as a store
 void fileOut(java.lang.String fileName)
          Saves the store as an object and saves it within a file
 void firstAccountPointer()
          points to first account which is that of the first object in the array
 boolean isEmpty()
          Checks if the store is empty
 boolean isFirst()
          Checks if the current pointer is set at the first record
 boolean isLast()
          Checks if the current pointer is set at the last record
 void lastAccountPointer()
          points to the last account which is that of the size of the array -1
 void nextAccountPointer()
          Points to the next account pointer, which increments the currentAccountIndex
 void previousAccountPointer()
          Points to the previous account record, which decrements the currentAccountIndex
 void removeAccount(Account account)
          removes an account from the array list

currentAccount

public Account currentAccount()
Returns the account corresponding the the currentAccountIndex which are navigated through by the firstAccountPointer, lastAccountPointer, previousAccountPointer and nextAccountPointer methods

Returns:
returns the current record

firstAccountPointer

points to first account which is that of the first object in the array

lastAccountPointer

points to the last account which is that of the size of the array -1

Points to the next account pointer, which increments the currentAccountIndex

previousAccountPointer

Points to the previous account record, which decrements the currentAccountIndex

Returns:

fileOut

public void fileOut(java.lang.String fileName)
Saves the store as an object and saves it within a file

Parameters:
fileName - the file name the file is to be saved as
Throws:
e - if an error exists in object streaming and writing the file
ioe - if an error exists in flushing and closing the object output stream

fileIn

public Store fileIn(java.lang.String fileName)
Opens a file and casts the object found within that file as a store

Parameters:
fileName - the file name the file is to be opened
Returns:
returns the store found within the file
Throws:
e - if any errors exists in reading and casting the object
ioe - if an errors exists in closing the object input stream

public void displayAll()
A method which prints all the account records found within a store to the screen in a way that the user can understand
